author: ThomasNieto
body:
# Details of the Distribution

- Name of the Distribution: Linux Mint
- Version of the Distribution: 19.3
- Processor Architecture (One per request): 64
- [x] **Required** - https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell-Docker/issues/369 - An issues has been filed to create a Docker image in https://github.com/powershell/powershell-docker
- The following is a requirement for supporting a distribution **without exception.**
  - [x] The version and architecture of the Distribution is [supported by .NET Core](https://github.com/dotnet/core/blob/master/release-notes/3.0/3.0-supported-os.md#linux).
- The following are requirements for supporting a distribution.
  Please write a justification for any exception where these criteria are not met and 
  the PowerShell comittee will review the request.
  - [x] The version of the Distribution is supported for at least one year.
  - [x] The version of the Distribution is not an [interim release](https://ubuntu.com/about/release-cycle) or equivalent.

## Progress - For PowerShell Team **ONLY**

- [ ] Docker image created
- [ ] Docker image published
- [ ] Distribution tested
- [ ] Update `packages.microsoft.com` deployment
- [ ] Lifecycle updated
- [ ] Documentation Updated

Releases - Linux Mint
Linux Mint is an elegant, easy to use, up to date and comfortable GNU/Linux desktop distribution.

comments.author: ThomasNieto
comments.body: @TravisEz13 when do you think Linux Mint can be added?

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: @PowerShell/powershell-committee Can your review this request to build and support and additional package and docker image?

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @ThomasNieto what exactly are you requesting?  We expect the Ubuntu docker image, deb pkg, and Snap pkg to work already with Mint.

comments.author: ThomasNieto
comments.body: .NET lists Linux Mint as a separate supported platform. If you think the Ubuntu binaries will work on Linux Mint then I would say this request would be to add Linux Mint to the README as a supported platform.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
> add Linux Mint to the README as a supported platform.

We don't tests on Mint so we can not say it is supported but we could add in README that PowerShell is supported by Mint community.

comments.author: ThomasNieto
comments.body: Any and all requirements for that platform to be officially supported by powershell would need to be done. This request is for Mint to be officially supported by powershell just like it's listed for dot net.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @ThomasNieto I think the Committee is trying to weigh the cost of the work involved vs the potential usage.

comments.author: JamesWTruher
comments.body: @powershell-committee has reviewed this request, and our current position is that adding any new release to our current list of supported platforms would be cost prohibitive.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: I think the current `deb` package should work as a community supported package for Mint.
